title: Chaos Temple (Asgarnia)

properties.value: The Chaos Temple is a temple of Zamorak located north of Falador, north-west of Goblin Village. It can be approached from the south by following the wall separating Taverley from Falador, or from the north by crossing the Wilderness ditch. Alternatively, if one has completed the easy Falador Diary, they may access it using the Tight-gap shortcut from Burthorpe.

This article is about the temple near the Goblin Village. For other uses, see Chaos Temple.
Chaos Temple

Falador

The Chaos Temple is a temple of Zamorak located north of Falador, north-west of Goblin Village. It can be approached from the south by following the wall separating Taverley from Falador, or from the north by crossing the Wilderness ditch. Alternatively, if one has completed the easy Falador Diary, they may access it using the Tight-gap shortcut from Burthorpe.

The building has two levels: the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] hosting several monks of Zamorak (level 17 & 22), one wine of Zamorak on a table as well as an altar; the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] floor hosting a single monk of Zamorak (level 22), and one wine of Zamorak on the table (the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] requires a total level of 500 to access and wearing Zamorak monk robes or the vestment robes. Members skills may count for this total, even on free-to-play worlds).

Stealing Wine of Zamorak[edit | edit source]

The interior of the Chaos Temple.

Players can steal the wine of Zamorak from the temple, which respawns every 30 seconds. Stealing wine of Zamorak does not give Thieving experience. The wine is a resource ingredient used to make ranging potions.

As a task in the medium Falador Diary, a player must telegrab the wine off the table.

To get the Wine of Zamorak, players can:

  • Use Telekinetic Grab on it.
  • Pick up the wine while all the monks are dead (resulting in 3-5 damage and combat stats drain).

On the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US], either method will make the monks aggressive, though using Telekinetic Grab will successfully add the item to your inventory. On the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US], a player can wear the Zamorak monk robes or the vestment robes to prevent being attacked when they're using Telekinetic Grab (physically trying to pick it up will get a player attacked regardless of outfit).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a shortcut leading to Burthorpe that you can use at level 14 agility if you have completed the Falador Easy Diary.

The '''Chaos Temple''' is a temple of [[Zamorak]] located north of [[Falador]], north-west of [[Goblin Village]]. It can be approached from the south by following the wall separating [[Taverley]] from Falador, or from the north by crossing the [[Wilderness ditch]]. Alternatively, if one has completed the easy [[Falador Diary]], they may access it using the [[Tight-gap]] shortcut from [[Burthorpe]].

The building has two levels: the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} hosting several [[Monk of Zamorak|monks of Zamorak]] (level 17 & 22), one [[wine of Zamorak]] on a table as well as an [[altar]]; the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} floor hosting a single monk of Zamorak (level 22), and one wine of Zamorak on the table (the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} requires a total level of 500 to access and wearing [[Zamorak monk robes]] or the [[Zamorak vestment set|vestment robes]]. Members skills may count for this total, even on free-to-play worlds).

==Stealing Wine of Zamorak==
[[File:Chaos Temple (Asgarnia) interior.png|left|thumb|220x220px|The interior of the Chaos Temple.]]
Players can steal the [[wine of Zamorak]] from the temple, which respawns every 30 seconds. Stealing wine of Zamorak does '''not''' give [[Thieving]] [[experience]]. The wine is a resource ingredient used to make [[ranging potion]]s.

As a task in the medium [[Falador Diary]], a player must telegrab the wine off the table.

To get the Wine of Zamorak, players can:
*Use [[Telekinetic Grab]] on it.
*Pick up the wine while all the monks are dead (resulting in 3-5 damage and combat stats drain).

On the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}}, either method will make the monks aggressive, though using Telekinetic Grab will successfully add the item to your inventory. On the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}, a player can wear the [[Zamorak monk robes]] or the [[Zamorak vestment set|vestment robes]] to prevent being attacked when they're using Telekinetic Grab (physically trying to pick it up will get a player attacked regardless of outfit).
